channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: The 15-year-old was found on Tuesday night after being last seen at a home at Penshurst on Monday morning.
item.title: Missing Penshurst teenager found 'safe and well'

item.description: The latest row began in early May, when Chinese soldiers entered the Indian-controlled territory of Ladakh at three different points.
item.title: Whatâ€™s driving the latest India-China border tension

item.description: Wall Street's rally extends to a third day on encouraging numbers, but Fed chairman Jerome Powell says a full economic recovery is a long way off.
item.title: Wall Street jumps on signs of economic recovery, but Fed cautions 'long road' ahead

item.description: A steroid called dexamethasone reduced deaths by up to one third in severely ill hospitalised patients, according to UK-led clinical study.
item.title: First drug proves able to improve survival from COVID-19, trial shows

item.description: France's tourism industry is slowly opening back up as the pandemic-ravaged economy looks to get back on its feet.
item.title: Eiffel Tower to reopen after longest closure since WWII

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: One charity group whose committee is made up of ALP members and staffers received a large number of payments between 2015 and 2019.
item.title: Fallen minister Robin Scott signed off on grants to factional allies

item.description: Juneteenth, which is also called Emancipation Day and Freedom Day, is celebrated annually on June 19. Texas first made it a state holiday in 1980.
item.title: 'Time we elevate this': Virginia governor wants Juneteenth a state holiday

item.description: The IMF says the economic upheaval triggered by the pandemic was more global and playing out differently than past crises.
item.title: IMF sees 'profound uncertainty' about global recovery

item.description: A detox facial for your puffy skin or a massage for your sore, stressed muscles? Ahead, where to go and what to ask for when bookings are few and far between.
item.title: It's time for some self-care. These luxury beauty treatments can help

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: A jury will be asked to decide which of two convicted criminals is to be believed: Rodney Adler or the man who is accused of deceiving him.
item.title: Rodney Adler in new role as the 'victim' of white collar crime

item.description: Following weeks of national protests since the death of George Floyd, US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order on policing.
item.title: Donald Trump signs executive order on police reform

item.description: The Indian Army has raised the death toll in a clash with Chinese troops on a disputed Himalayan border from three to 20 Indian soldiers.
item.title: India says 20 soldiers killed in clash with Chinese troops

item.description: Albuquerque police have arrested a former city council candidate and charged him with shooting and critically injuring a protester.
item.title: Former council candidate charged with shooting of New Mexico protester

item.description: Here's one more behaviour to be hyper-aware of in order to prevent coronavirus transmission: what you do after you use the toilet.
item.title: Flushing the toilet may fling coronavirus aerosols everywhere

item.description: The US Open will be held from August 31-September 13 without fans as part of New York's reopening from shutdowns related to the COVID-19 outbreak, Andrew Cuomo said.
item.title: US Open to go ahead without fans, New York Governor says

item.dc:creator: Michael Evans
item.description: Two Australian men held in Dubai labelled the kingpins of a major crime syndicate as police arrest three in Sydney raids.
item.title: 'Drug kingpins' held in Dubai as arrests cap seven-year investigation

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: The PM may have looked at our prospective budget deficits and taken fright.
item.title: With economic recovery far from assured, the PM's nerve may be fraying

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: In a late submission to the NSW inquiry the deputy premier says hazard reduction and traditional ecological burns are "under-utilised".
item.title: Fire experts say hazard reduction burns help but not the solution

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Paid parental leave has become more flexible but the changes do not help mothers who lost their jobs during the pandemic or fix an anomaly that enforces gender roles.
item.title: Parental leave tweaks boost flexibility but fail gender equality test

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: It comes after the ombudsman made 10 recommendations to improve confidentiality safeguards for people making complaints about healthcare practitioners.
item.title: Peak health regulator to ask for protection for healthcare complainants

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Michael O'Connor felt 'awkward' as a Wallabies selector and says it was a failure of leadership that players who disagreed with coach Michael Cheika's game plan said nothing..
item.title: 'Always going to end in tears': O'Connor says Cheika's Wallabies were doomed to fail at World Cup

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The majority of Tesla shareholders regard Musk as a corporate messiah and they his (enriched) disciples but governance issues are causing headaches for the board.
item.title: Messiah Musk: Tesla disciples don't care if he's not a governance god

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Political leaders, farmers and academics are demanding answers from investors of the Chinese conglomerate set to destroy Aboriginal artefacts in regional NSW.
item.title: US funds titan BlackRock 'deeply concerned' about NSW coal mine

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: The peak of NSW's COVID-19 pandemic triggered a run on coronavirus tests that threatened to overwhelm Sydney's emergency departments.
item.title: Healthy people deluged Sydney's emergency departments at peak of COVID crisis

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Melbourneâ€™s office market will struggle with the fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic more than Sydney and Brisbane CBDs.
item.title: Pandemic to hit Melbourne offices more than Sydney's

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: There's a lot to be learnt from Trafalgar Square's example.
item.title: Rather than tear down Sydney's statues, let's look to London

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Medtech startup SpeeDx is hoping to expand international sales of its sexually transmitted infection and antibiotic resistance tests after inking a deal with global healthcare giant Roche.
item.title: Aussie startup SpeeDx eyes medical test boom after deal with Swiss giant

item.description: Removing statues does not expunge knowledge of history, it simply means we no longer glorify it.
item.title: Protests highlight the true history of Australia

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: The buyer intends to renovate and part-occupy it in the future.
item.title: Converted inner-city factory sells for $4.4m

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The state government has introduced proposed laws to freeze the wages of hundreds of thousands of public servants for a year in a bid to save half a billion dollars.Â
item.title: Wage freeze laws to be rushed through Parliament this week

item.description: Two very different documentaries shine a light on the life and death of the billionaire paedophile.
item.title: Life of Jeffrey Epstein leaves viewer feeling grubby, queasy, angry

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: Ed Kavalee was a relative unknown when the improv comedy show launched in 2006.
item.title: Thank God You're Here: revisiting a landmark of Australian comedy

item.dc:creator: Brian Toohey
item.description: The Morrison government is reaching out to the Five Eyes electronic espionage group on economic issues.
item.title: Five Eyes largely blind to COVID threat, so why deepen economic ties?

item.description: On the birthday of Henry Lawson, we revisit an interview with Leonard Teale, an actor deeply involved with the beloved poet and committed to his works.
item.title: From the Archives, 1979: Living the life of Henry Lawson

item.description: I may have been one of a handful of people in Sydney to feel the most intimate aspects of despair brought about by the destruction of George Floyd.
item.title: The pains of beholding my country from a distance

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The NSW Building Commissioner has warned developers he will use his new powers to stop them forcing people who buy off-the-plan to settle on apartments in buildings with significant defects.
item.title: Sydney's 'worst' apartment tower for defects forces industry shake-up

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: City Tattersalls Club, one of the largest and oldest clubs in Sydney, has moved a step closer to its proposed $200 million mixed-use tower.
item.title: City Tatts shortlists designs for $200m tower

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Itâ€™s just on a year since Liberal political veteran Christopher Pyne left politics and the Canberra Bubble for a new life in consulting.
item.title: Pyne and Partners working the books

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Berejiklian government wants NSW businesses to adapt to the new four-square-metre economy after the COVID-19 shutdown.
item.title: One-off $3000 boost for small business amid Sydney job slump

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Netball Australia has said it will join the national redress scheme for victims of childhood sexual abuse, prompting calls for other sporting bodies to sign up.
item.title: Netball Australia to join child abuse national redress scheme

item.description: We cannot afford, morally or economically, to give any ground to those who choose not to be vaccinated against COVID-19.
item.title: New COVID-19 restrictions will be needed for anti-vaxxers

item.description: After months of close living during lockdown, for many parents it is time again for sad goodbyes.
item.title: Parenting global kids: they come and they go

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Australia's emerging hydrogen industry has captured attention in Europe, particularly in Germany.
item.title: Australia's Paris accord climate targets no barrier to EU trade deal: Birmingham

item.description: UK Prime Minister will provide a food fund for struggling families, bowing to pressure from England forward Marcus Rashford to prevent children from going hungry during the pandemic.
item.title: Boris Johnson bows to footballer's pressure to provide summer food fund

item.description: New research shows that massive slavery compensation payments helped fund Australia's settlement by the British.
item.title: Australiaâ€™s deep connection with enslavement

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Wednesday, June 17

item.description: Police have not released any information about the suspected shooter or said whether they believe he has any connection to the armed militia.
item.title: Militia members detained after man shot at Albuquerque protest

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 17, 2020

item.description: The federal government is holding a massive $1.2 billion of other peopleâ€™s unclaimed money; NSW has $442 million of our cash and Queensland is sitting on $159 million.
item.title: Free cash: How to check if you are owed any unclaimed money

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australians are being warned of a huge blow to future investment if governments cannot reach a deal to fast-track approvals under a contentious change to environmental law.
item.title: 'You can't mine with teaspoons': minister calls for speedy decisions
